commit.message:
Added fast clipping (frame boundaries and magnitude) of the source list entries.
Pushed version number to 4.2.0.
Fixed DEB parallel building issue.
Added support for RPM and DEB release numbers.
Fixed more crashes with very large images.
Fixed crash in noise generation with very large images.

Random seed now updated every microsec instead of every sec.
Pushed version number to 4.1.1

Local Jacobian matrices of astrometric projections are now applied to galaxy shapes in LISTCOORD_TYPE WORLD mode.
Pushed version number 4.1.0.
Fixed error secondary obstruction error message.
Added warning when M2 obstruction fills the whole pupil plane.
Fixed image size issue when saving PSF models.
Object positions within de code now follow the FITS convention (first pixel is (1,1)).
Fixed crash with external headers.
Added missing requirements.txt in doc.
Fixed possibility of overflow in image resampling with crazy input coordinates.

Fixed a few issues with autoconfig.
Doc: added conf.py for RTD generation.
Added doc and debian directories.
Fixed package naming and packaging issues.

Added computation of minimum surface brightness when using weight maps.
Fixed issue in regions with weight 0.
Fixed bug in noise generation when using weight maps.

Fixed noise pipeline (still missing gain modulation and automatic SB floor level).
Pushed version number to 4.0.0.

Added CORREL_FUNC_TYPE and CORREL_SCALE configuration settings.
Added support for CORREL_TYPE ALL mode.
Moved convolution routines to corr.c.
Noise is now simulated and convolved on the uncropped pixel grid.
Correlation function compution remains to be parallelized.
Added generators for nearest neightbour, bi-linear and Lanczos2,3,4 correlation square-root functions.

Added OpenMP version of noise generator.
Added ax_openmp.m4 in m4/ autoconf directory.
Added missing corr.c and corr.h files.
Added corr module for generating correlation square root functions.
Added noise correlation routines.
Implemented weight map support (still missing detector gain management).
